channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023090518
item.description:
Report X-2023090518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER, SCANNED INTO THE BUILDING AND GLASS WAS HEARD RATTLING AS THE PACKAGE MOVED DOWN THE BELT. PACKAGE REMOVED, PLACED IN TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DAMAGE AREA. DescribePack: GLASS BOTTLE INSIDE OUTER PACKING IS SMASHED. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE - HOWEVER OUTER CONTAINER WAS DRY BY THE TIME IT WAS RECEIVED AT ENAS.

item.title: Report E-2023100034
item.description:
Report E-2023100034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1210 was crushed during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. R+L terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to HES' arrival. HES personnel swept in the previously deployed granular absorbents with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted trailer interior, pallet, and nearby freight with absorbent pads and a degreaser. All spent absorbents, the pail of solidified product, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2023090788
item.description:
Report E-2023090788

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023, at 0840 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Chattanooga, Tennessee regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE F, LIQUID (UN3109, 5.2) from (1) 55-gallon plastic drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The release was caused by a missing lid and contained to a 3’ x 53’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to neutralize and clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023090338
item.description:
Report X-2023090338

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 5 gallon plastic drum discovered with no visible sign of leakage but exhibiting corrosion (green staining) of barcode. Transported to HMPA in lined tote. DescribePack: Trace amount lost of Formic acid; no visible signs of leakage. Corroded barcode present. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used. Caution was used when inspecting for sources of leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023090337
item.description:
Report X-2023090337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Odorous leaking fiberboard box found with no diamond labels or markings. Transported to HMPA staging pallet in a lined tote. DescribePack: One 1 gallon plastic bottle lost three tablespoons of fluid due to inadequate preparation for transport: loose cap closure, box capacity four times that of inner bottle, and inadequate dunnage provided to fill empty space. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used. Spillage absorbed and placed in lined tote.

  • Description: 1. X-2023090335 SequenceEvent: The sequence of events is unknown. DescribePack: One of the four containers had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in an open contents bin and brought to QA. 2. X-2023090343 SequenceEvent: The sequence of events is unknown DescribePack: The package was leaked on by another hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA for evaluation.

item.title: Report X-2023090334
item.description:
Report X-2023090334

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: one out of two 2.5-gallon bottles experienced leakage due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023090326
item.description:
Report X-2023090326

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box originally containing thirty-five (upon discovery containing twenty-one) metal inverted aerosol cans found on HMPA staging pallet. No diamond labels/markings were found on package. Prior events and transporter of damaged package in tote unknown. May be related to recall/buyback program of fluorescent pink aerosol by Rust-oleum. DescribePack: Search continues for fourteen cans. At least three cans lost 45oz of fluid and gas from inadequate preparation for transport. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023090306
item.description:
Report X-2023090306

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED UPON UNLOAD. BOX WAS WET FROM INNER LEAKAGE. PACKAGE REMOVED FROM TRAILER AND PLACED IN TOTE DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES APPEAR TO BE CRUSHED CAUSING INNER LEAKAGE FROM ONE INNER PACKAGE VIA A LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED UPRIGHT IN TOTE AND MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE.
